sources.data_found: Vista: 600 Grace-Hopper (GH) nodes; each GH node has 1 GPU; text describes the GH node GPU as an NVIDIA H200 GPU with 96 GiB HBM3; total GH nodes=600.
Vista systems page lists GPU as H100 (Grace Hopper/GH200 Superchip) and shows the system has GH and GG components.
Stampede3: 24 H100 nodes; each node has 4x NVIDIA H100 SXM5 GPUs (H100 queue).
Lonestar6: 84 A100 GPU nodes, each with 3x NVIDIA A100 PCIe 40GB; plus 4 H100 GPU nodes, each with 2x NVIDIA H100 PCIe 80GB.
Longhorn (decommissioned 11/30/2022): 96 V100 nodes + 8 large-memory V100 nodes; each node has 4x V100 GPUs (total 104 GPU nodes).
Maverick2 (decommissioned): 4 nodes each with 2x V100; and 3 nodes each with 2x P100.

student_data.notes: I located a UT Austin Computer Science (UTCS) official 'About' page that explicitly contains the text 'incoming, fall 2024'. However, the page does NOT provide Fall 2024 (or AY 2024-25) Computer Science enrollment headcounts broken out by (1) undergraduate CS majors, (2) on-campus MS/Masters CS students, and (3) CS PhD students. The page does include a single combined figure ('7,600 undergrad + graduate students'), but it is not explicitly labeled as Fall 2024 enrollment and it also does not separate MS vs PhD, so I rejected using it for the required fields and left all counts as 0. I also checked UT Austin IRRIS/Reports pages (Common Data Set and Trends in Student Data) but could not access a Fall 2024 CS-major enrollment table (MS vs PhD vs undergrad) from those pages without the interactive dashboard data being directly visible as text.

gpu_resources.notes:
Clusters tallied (including decommissioned systems):
1) Vista: interpreted as H100-class (non-PCIe) GPUs based on Vista systems page listing GPU=H100 and GH200 context; counted as H100 SXM-equivalent due to non-PCIe form factor. Calculation: 600 nodes × 1 GPU/node = 600 H100 (SXM-equivalent). Note: Vista system documentation text conflicts by calling the GPU 'H200' while also stating 96 GiB HBM3; H200 is typically higher-memory, so this appears inconsistent; totals here categorize Vista under H100 SXM.
2) Stampede3 H100 nodes: 24 nodes × 4 H100 SXM5/node = 96 H100 SXM.
3) Lonestar6 H100 nodes: 4 nodes × 2 H100 PCIe/node = 8 H100 PCIe.
4) Lonestar6 A100 nodes: 84 nodes × 3 A100 40GB/node = 252 A100 40GB.
5) Longhorn V100 nodes: (96+8)=104 nodes × 4 V100/node = 416 V100.
6) Maverick2 V100 nodes: 4 nodes × 2 V100/node = 8 V100.
7) Maverick2 P100 nodes: 3 nodes × 2 P100/node = 6 P100.
Summed totals: H100 SXM=600+96=696; H100 PCIe=8; A100 40GB=252; V100=416+8=424; P100=6.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
validation_notes: GPU CHANGES: All GPU counts set to 0 because the listed resources (Vista, Stampede3, Lonestar6) are part of the Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC), which is a shared resource. STUDENT CHANGES: No changes made to student data as per instructions.
